summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, setting a firm trial date of November 29, 2021, and establishing a detailed schedule for jury selection, motions, and pretrial conferences leading up to the trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order is issued, setting her trial schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order, setting the trial date and related deadlines.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judge in the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, issuing orders regarding the trial schedule.

events.title: Trial Commencement
events.description: The jury trial in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to commence.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Jury Selection
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters.

events.title: In-Person Pretrial Conference
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for an in-person pretrial conference.

events.title: Previous Schedule Order
events.description: The Court had previously set a schedule on this date, which is now being amended.

keyFacts: A firm trial date for Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case was set for November 29, 2021.
The order establishes specific dates for jury questionnaire administration (November 4, 5, 12) and voir dire (November 16-19).
Deadlines are set for the parties to submit joint proposals for juror questionnaires, voir dire, charges, and motions in limine in October 2021.
The scheduling accounts for COVID-19 protocols in the Southern District of New York, including space limitations.
The document is a formal court order amending a previous schedule and mandating party compliance with the new timeline.
